results.title: Product Design Director
results.description:
Leadfeeder is a fast growing international SaaS scale-up. We are on a mission to bring web intelligence into business. Simply put, Leadfeeder helps companies know more about their website visitors, which enables them to convert promising visitors into sales leads.

We’re excited to share that Leadfeeder has merged with Echobot, a leading provider of European Sales Intelligence. As a result, we now have 250+ team members based across 30+ countries and six offices across the US and Europe. Together, our companies are striving to be the leading sales intelligence and go-to-market platform in our core European and North American markets.

Are you a self-starter looking to learn and grow as part of a world-class team? We are hiring many key people around the world to strengthen our rapid growth. Join our journey!


About this role

Leadfeeder & Echobot are looking for an experienced Product Design Director who will act as a lead to oversee all Product Design efforts in our combined company. You will be in charge of a team of product designers and implement and manage a design system for the company. Key focuses for the role are to find an optimal collaboration approach with the key stakeholders in Product and Engineering and to hire and grow the best product design talent in our organization.

The goal is to ensure Product Design is serving our customers with the best product experience in collaboration with the larger product team within the limits of budget, time and specifications of the company.


Responsibilities

  • Distill abstract business concepts and client needs into elegant creative solutions.
  • Take responsibility for the creative vision and the standard of output across team members who work under them.
  • Pitch ideas confidently and present the creative vision clearly to clients, as well as communicate in the same manner to members of the creative team.
  • Have strong people management and leadership skills in order to hire, develop, and inspire the creative team.
  • Ensure that all creative output/visuals are consistent with the overall brand.
  • Implement and manage an industry-standard design delivery process to coordinate the hand-offs between design and the product and engineering teams
  • Lead multiple projects from conception to completion in accordance with deadlines.
  • Collaborate with other team members and stakeholders.
  • Champion new ideas and gain support within the organization


Requirements

  • A degree in a visual or experiential design discipline or equivalent professional experience.
  • 5+ years of experience as a senior-level designer. Preference will be given to candidates who have experience directing complex solutions for SaaS products.
  • Extensive supervisory experience (including leadership, team-building, and delegation) leading and managing creative teams
  • Experience with design processes and systems of fast-growing companies between 200 and 1000 employees.
  • Ability to work effectively in a team setting, including synthesizing abstract ideas into concrete design implications.
  • Excellent interpersonal skills to clearly and effectively communicate the creative vision, concepts, ideas, and solutions to stakeholders, internal teams, and clients.
  • Be excited about collaborating and communicating closely with teams and other stakeholders via a distributed model to regularly deliver design solutions for approval.
  • Be open to receiving feedback and constructive criticism.
  • Based in Europe

 

Benefits

  • Personal budget for home office improvements
  • Company hardware or monthly financial support for using your own equipment
  • Up to 12 paid local bank holidays per year
  • Flexible working hours
  • Access to weekly yoga / fitness / meditation classes online
  • Mental Health support
  • Bi-annual company retreats

If this role excites you and sounds like a great fit, please apply below!

results.title: Creative Executive
results.description:
Who We Are

Our romantic relationship with our partner is one of the most important parts of our lives - it has an enormous impact on our happiness, our mental health, and the lives of our children. Paired is a user-centric mobile app with a clear mission to improve the happiness of couple relationships.

We believe there’s an opportunity to help couples stay connected via a fun, evidence-based, and affordable mobile app. We launched Paired in October 2020 and have won several awards since then, including being named one of Google’s Best Apps of 2020 and Apple App of the Day in November 2021. Our app is now used by more than 250,000 people a day and we’re poised to accelerate our growth, having closed an additional $4 million in funding in 2021.

 

About The Role

Are you a creative person who is passionate about data? Then this role is for you!

As Creative Executive, you will be the critical link between performance marketing and media design teams at Paired, supporting the development of performance-driven creatives that are optimised for our acquisition channels.
In this role, you will be responsible for supporting the creative strategy for our marketing team across channels such as Facebook, TikTok, YouTube, Influencers and Content Marketing, etc.

You will also be exploring ideas and leveraging insights to define content creatives’ briefs that are optimised for different channels and tailored to meet customer needs.

This is a unique opportunity to bring a product loved by millions of couples to the mainstream.

 

What Your Role Encompasses
  • Write creative briefs to boost campaign performance by combining your creativity with data, consumer insights, and digital trends
  • Collaborate with media design teams (internal or external) to deliver and bring creative briefs to life
  • Scout creators for UGC production, managing the whole process from sourcing to negotiation, content alignment, feedback and delivery of the final assets
  • Support projects with external creative partners (e.g. influencer agencies), helping to define the message and ensuring brand consistency
  • Ensure creative deliveries are optimised for different channels and audiences by collaborating with marketing, brand and product teams
  • Define and maintain a creative testing roadmap in order to drive innovation through a test-and-learn approach
  • Stay on-top of industry trends, developing and distributing creative best practices to drive best-in-class creative solutions and execution

 

Requirements

  • Relevant experience working on creative content within a performance marketing team or as a content strategist within an agency or platform
  • In depth-knowledge of the steps required in creative development processes with external creators and influencers
  • Exceptional writing and editing skills that can address various target audiences
  • Ability to create strategies based on data and industry trends
  • A creative mind that can devise unique conceptual ideas to pitch our product
  • Experience negotiating and handling contracts with relevant third parties
  • Good understanding and experience with Tiktok, Facebook, Youtube, and Influencer Marketing

Benefits

What We Offer
  • An innovative and collaborative environment with diversity of opinion at its core (we are a relationship app after all!)
  • Fully remote work setup from anywhere in Europe (& time zone GMT+1/+2)
  • 3x company offsites every year (e.g. in Malaga, Florence, Lisbon and Tirana...)
  • Subsidised co-working space
  • 25 days annual leave (+public holidays)
  • Yearly salary between £40K-45k / €46K-52K
  • Yearly learning budget of £1,000 / €1,150
  • Significant stock options
  • Enhanced maternity and paternity leave
  • Comprehensive health insurance
  • Modern tech setup: Figma-Miro, Notion, Slack, G-Suite, ...
  • Opportunity to help millions of people with their relationship

 

Diversity & Inclusion at Paired
  • Our core value is championing relationships. Our app was built to serve all couples regardless of culture, gender, sexual orientation, and ethnicity
  • We strive to create an inclusive environment where unique perspectives are encouraged, as we firmly believe that diversity enhances our company, culture and product. We’re looking for people from a range of different backgrounds across age, disability, gender and gender re-assignment, relationship status, sexual orientation, parenthood and pregnancy, race or nationality, and/or religion or belief
  • We regularly review our hiring processes, materials and pipeline to ensure they are accessible and free of bias, offering equal opportunity to underrepresented groups. We are also always learning. We maintain open minds and welcome feedback on how we can improve, no matter where it comes from



And one last thing…

Excited by our business but not sure if you meet the job criteria? Not to worry! If you feel you have that special something and could contribute to our mission, get in touch anyway. We are always looking to add great people and we know that you are more than your CV. We would encourage you to apply regardless as we don’t believe that ticking off a list of skills is the only thing that makes a great candidate.

results.title: Principal Product Designer
results.description:
ConsumerAffairs helps consumers make smart buying decisions in moments of need. Every month millions of consumers turn to our site and tools for help with their considered (often emotional) purchases.

We educate them about their options, learn about their specific needs, and connect hundreds of thousands of them directly to brands. These brands use our SaaS tools to manage their reviews and communicate directly with consumers to serve them better. Our business thrives when the consumers who trust us get matched with the right brands for them.

We’re fast-paced and our core values are the bedrock of who we are and who we want to be.

Our employees believe in raising the bar through data-driven innovation, intellectual curiosity, and grit. We have a team first mentality, and manifest wins by putting the team first. Collaboration and teamwork is in our hearts and we believe winning together is the most fun. But, above all else, we care. We have servant hearts for our consumers, customers, and colleagues. If you want to be part of a globally diverse team that’s focussed on helping people, in an environment where we raise the bar, win as a team, and care above all else—then ConsumerAffairs may be just the place for you!

ABOUT THE JOB:

Your role will be threefold:

  • Research oriented, prepared to dive deep into the problem space and existing approaches across developer tools, but not afraid to break the mold and innovate when it serves our mission and users. Excited to go broad and explore before going deep.
  • An insightful problem solver, capable of autonomously defining and executing on a technical vision, but eager to collaborate on it.
  • Deeply live iterative product development: balancing speed and iteration with quality and maintainability, and adjust that balance based on the situation.
  • Take pride in the designs that you make. You value a clean, elegant and efficient design system, and encourage the same for your team.
  • Are biased toward action: you deliver results quickly and iterate instead of waiting for perfection.
  • Be hands-on to execute on the vision with the team of designers.
  • Partner with engineering to ensure that our implementation and user experience are of high-quality.
  • Solicit feedback from your peers, including other product designers and product managers, engineers and other applicable cross-functional partners
  • Work in close collaboration with the VP of Design to inform and improve our design processes.


RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Problem Opportunity & Framing; Proactively discover company-level opportunities whose justifications are extremely challenging and help bring clarity and insight to these problems.
  • Ownership; Of specific design-led projects that you proactively seek out. As well as working with the VP of Design to identify programs of work where your direction and expertise are needed to guide the work to a successful customer focussed outcome.
  • Execution; Work across the entire design organization to ensure that the quality of craft execution and our design practices are to the high standards that our business and customers expect.
  • Strategy; In close partnership with the VP Design and Leadership Team, help to execute and inform the ongoing evolution of the Design strategy and influence the Product strategies across our company.
  • Impact; You can develop innovative patterns and systems that are durable, and repeatable, and set a new standard for interaction for the company.
  • Collaborate with PMs and engineers in an iterative, transparent, and feedback-driven process.
  • Establish a design system and allows designers across product and marketing to meet user needs and develop highly converting experiences.
  • Elevate the voice of the Design team company-wide and ensure they are the chief voice of the customer.
  • Collaborate to create best-in-class practices for user research both qualitative and quantitative.
  • Meet professional obligations through efficient work habits such as meeting deadlines, honoring schedules, coordinating resources in an effective and timely manner and demonstrate respect for others.

(These responsibilities are not to be construed as a complete statement of all duties performed. Employees will be required to perform other job related duties as required)

Requirements

Experience:

  • Experience building products in a remote or distributed team environment.
  • Demonstrated portfolio of shipping amazing customer experiences that have made a significant impact on business and customer metrics.
  • Prior marketplace experience preferred
  • You have led teams of or managed other UX practitioners.
  • Experience in design thinking methodologies to lead teams toward customer-centered outcomes

Knowledge, skills and abilities:

  • 7 years experience in a senior Individual Contributor role.
  • Exceptional interaction and visual design skills.
  • Deep organization and execution capabilities, especially in areas of influence and collaboration with multiple stakeholder groups
  • Excellent written/verbal communication - an engaging storyteller.
  • Proven ability to hold conversations on design principles with organization leaders
  • Loves collaborating with engineers – enjoys translating complex, static designs to production-ready code.
  • Obsessed with ensuring an exceptional customer experience- for both internal and external customers.
  • Stands up for decisions, takes responsibility for results, and shares both good and bad outcomes transparently.
  • Demonstrates a relentless focus on results with a commitment to deliver;
  • Takes decisive action, and confidently changes course if unsuccessful.
  • Displays a growth mindset to continually improve; encourages everyone around them to to be tenacious and never settle.
  • Constantly seeks feedback to improve; Focussed on solving issues through team work, and collaboration
  • Acts with urgency; delivers top results in hours and days instead of weeks and months.
  • Relentless in their pursuit of success and possesses the willpower to embrace challenges as opportunities.


CORE VALUES:

Raise The Bar

  • We raise the bar through innovation, intellectual curiosity, and grit. We are not satisfied with yesterday and our hearts thirst to be better tomorrow.

Win As A Team

  • We manifest wins by putting the team first. We have collaboration and teamwork in our hearts and believe winning together is the most fun.

Care Above All Else

  • We care above all else. We have servant hearts for our consumers, customers, and colleagues.


PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS AND ENVIRONMENTAL CONDITIONS:

  • Location: Remote
  • Frequency of travel: Occasional travel may be required for meetings, training and/or conferences.
  • Light physical activities and efforts required in working within an office environment.


(Reasonable accommodations will be made in accordance with existing ADA requirements for otherwise qualified individuals with disabilities.)

ConsumerAffairs does not discriminate in admission or access to, or treatment or employment in its programs and activities on the basis of race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, marital status, disability, genetic information or any other reason prohibited by law.

Benefits

  • Health Care Plan (Medical, Dental & Vision)
  • Retirement Plan (401k, IRA)
  • Life Insurance (Basic, Voluntary & AD&D)
  • Paid Time Off (Vacation, Sick & Public Holidays)
  • Family Leave (Maternity, Paternity)
  • Short Term & Long Term Disability
  • Training & Development
  • Work From Home
  • Free Food & Snacks
  • Stock Option Plan

results.title: Senior Multiplayer Designer
results.description:
Company Description

To create revolutionary, story-driven RPGs which go straight to the hearts of gamers — this is our mission. As a driven team of talented professionals from all around the globe, we want to earn our place as one of the world’s top video-game developers, push narrative boundaries, and build unforgettable stories that set and redefine the standards for the genre.



Job Description

CD PROJEKT RED is looking for a Senior Multiplayer Designer to support The Molasses Flood development studio in their own ambitious project. The person in this role will help drive the vision and implementation of the multiplayer experience in our game. Working alongside the Lead Multiplayer Designer and Design Director, you will actively work on engaging multiplayer gameplay features, game modes, player progression and social systems, driving them all from concept to implementation. You will also work collaboratively with the systems design, engineering, art, and production teams to make sure that the experiences your team creates are fun, engaging, and performant, and help to tell the story of the game. The Senior Multiplayer Designer will report directly to the Lead Multiplayer Designer. 

Daily Responsibilities

  • Proposing and documenting an innovative design for multiplayer systems and features that follow the game direction. 
  • Iterating and improving documentation for existing multiplayer systems and features.
  • Designing, prototyping, scripting, iterating on features using Unreal Engine 5. 
  • Working in multidisciplinary teams on prototyping and implementing various game modes, ensuring that the multiplayer experience and networking are carried through to completion in the highest possible quality.
  • Taking ownership of specific features/systems of the game. 



Qualifications
  • At least 6 years of overall game design experience, ideally in a multiplayer or core gameplay position, with at least 1 AA/AAA shipped title with strong multiplayer design elements.
  • Very high proficiency working with Unreal Engine 4 and/or Unreal Engine 5. 
  • Experience with co-op multiplayer design.
  • Openness to receiving and giving feedback about your work.
  • Ability to include others in the design process.
  • Highly passionate about multiplayer games and systems (game modes, class design, player progression, social activities, etc.).
  • Curiosity, kindness, and a positive and professional can-do attitude.
  • Fluent in English.

Nice to have

  • Experience prototyping in Unreal Engine on multiplayer Co-Op/PvE titles.
  • Experience with action design.
  • Passionate about the Witcher universe and lore.
  • Mentoring experience. 
  • Experience or interest in procedurally generated levels.



Additional Information

Working mode

For this role you can choose between a remote-first or office-first working mode.

  • Office-First: working primarily from the Warsaw, Wroclaw, or Cracow studio for a minimum of 10 days per month.
  • Remote-First: working from home, or from any location that is within 3 hours of the GMT+2 time zone.

Perks & Professional Growth

  • Flexible working hours — start your workday anytime between 8:00 and 10:00 AM.
  • A welcome pack filled with goodies — to help you feel right at home once you join the team.
  • Trainings, lectures and courses — internal workshops, external training for each employee, ‘Meet a star’ events, knowledge-sharing initiatives, online tutorials, and e-learning classes are all available. There’s always something to learn!
  • Merch — employee store discounts at CD PROJEKT RED Gear, gifts for newborn rebels and regular chances to nab some cool swag!

Health & Well-being

  • Private medical healthcare — a selection of medical plans with dental care to choose from, which are also accessible for your partner and relatives.
  • Support during COVID-19 — regular tests and COVID vaccinations at the studio as well as professional advice and guidance from a specialist doctor.
  • Psychological care — free mental health support and various well-being webinars. 
  • Multisport card — gain access to a wide number of sporting and fitness facilities across the city.

Social Activities & Life in the Office

  • Dog-friendly office — dog owner? Bring your pooch with you and look after them while working! There’s always a furry friend or two to meet at the studio.
  • Social events — we host regular gatherings at the studio where we can all unwind, play games, and just have some fun together.
  • Healthy selections — ​​organic fruit, snacks, muesli, organic honey, vegan milk, and specialty coffee are all at your disposal around the studio. Enjoy!
  • Truly international working environment — a chance to meet and work with a diverse selection of people from all around the world.

Head office in Warsaw

  • Sustainable campus with an eco ethos — solar panels provide green energy, 2000 plants and an air-filtering system to help provide clean air, electric car charging points, flower meadows, and more green features in the works.
  • An onsite, well-equipped gym with a climbing wall and a personal trainer available every day and pilates classes.
  • Car and bike parking spaces.
  • A designated space for your bicycle, as well as bicycle repair equipment and showers available whenever you need them. 
  • No dress-code — we like to keep it casual.

Relocation support

  • Relocation package – flight ticket, company apartment for your first month, relocating your pet, shipping your belongings: it’s all covered. Who said moving countries needs to be complicated?
  • Relocation assistance — processing your legalization operations for you, assistance with finding residence, tax settlements, helping out with translations if needed, and much more —  we have dedicated teams to help make sure that all you need to feel right at home is taken care of.
  • Polish lessons for foreign employees — and for your spouse or partner, too.
  • Paid Leave — from 20 to 26 days of holiday for every team member per year, paid sick leave, and paid maternity & paternity leave.

results.title: Digital Marketing Designer
results.description:
About Resilia
Resilia is a fast growing, venture backed, mission-driven SaaS startup powering a digital transformation in the nonprofit sector. Our mission is to strengthen nonprofit capacity and help grantors scale impact through data-driven technology solutions. Resilia’s three SaaS-based products help nonprofits achieve tax exempt status, build capacity in pursuit of becoming high performing organizations, while enabling corporations and foundations to support nonprofits beyond grant awards. As a company, Resilia was named 2022 Best Tech Startup in New Orleans, Rising Star on the 2020 Forbes Cloud 100 list, VentureBeat's Companies to Watch list and Sevetri Wilson, Resilia’s Founder and CEO, has been recognized in Inc Magazine's 100 Women Building America's Most Innovative Companies and Pitchbook's top Black Tech Leaders list. The company recently closed a historic Series B raise: the $35 million round will fuel growth and impact for the company’s 15,000+ nonprofit users, and marks the largest single VC raise ever by a solo Black female-founded tech company. For more information visit resilia.com.

This is a remote role that may require occasional travel, including to Resilia’s New York and New Orleans offices for collaborative opportunities such as team retreats and gatherings. This role is expected to work either Eastern or Central hours. #LI-remote

Market Opportunity

Every nonprofit is unique and so are their capacity needs. Yet they find it difficult to access capacity building solutions that meet them where they are. Resilia’s mission is to strengthen and uplift nonprofit organizations by elevating their stories, driving advocacy efforts, and prioritizing those that are underserved through long-term capacity building. We serve nonprofits, foundations, corporations, governments, and other grantmakers, centered on trust-based philanthropy principles and meeting changemakers where they are.

Resilia’s three Software-as-a-Services products are designed with a human touch.

  • Nonprofit Formation - Empowers brand-new nonprofits to achieve tax exempt status while enabling annual compliance.
  • Nonprofit Platform - Provides capacity building support in fundraising, board management, program management and the collection of data.
  • Funder Program - Sponsored by grantmakers (foundations, governments, corporations), nonprofits are able to build mission-facing and back office capacity in a manner that best suits them. Resilia’s Funder Program meets nonprofits where they are through a combination of an online platform, 1:1 nonprofit coaching and peer-to-peer learning.

With a first-to-market solution and a team of builders with extensive startup, nonprofit, and corporate experiences, Resilia is well poised to democratize technology in order to solve some of the social good sector’s biggest legacy challenges, while re-defining the notion of technology for good.

About the Role

Resilia’s Marketing team is a key growth driver for the company, supporting all three product lines while enabling brand awareness in a mission-first manner.

As the first Digital Marketing Designer, you will be responsible for Resilia’s digital marketing visual creative, seeing projects through from concept to completion.

As digital marketing content crafter, you will design and create eye-catching, error-free conversion-rate focused marketing assets that represent Resilia’s brand.

You enjoy brainstorming, conceptualizing and turning creative ideas into clean, attractive, goal-oriented designs.

You have digital marketing design experience creating website landing pages and visuals for email, social media, social ads, display ads, web elements, and videos. You have developed animated and video content for use on Facebook, Instagram, Pinterest, Tiktok, Linkedin, Youtube, websites, etc; and keep current with emerging digital marketing trends, software and design concepts.

As our marketing design guru, you will collaborate closely with fellow marketing team members and various stakeholders to deliver quality content, designed to appeal visually, engage users, and generate high conversion rates.

You will collaborate with Resilia's Design Manager to ensure synchronicity of our brand and our product’s visual language and design values, and be an active contributor to the evolution of our design systems at the company level.

You are eager to make our story accessible and support thousands of nonprofits organizations.

This role encompasses graphic, video and web.

What you will do
  • Manage digital marketing visual creative, from concept to completion
  • Create high conversion rate focused marketing collateral including landing pages, website elements, email graphics, digital marketing campaigns, paid ad and social creative, etc.
  • Work on a variety of platforms and media including: web, video, social, email, animation, and occasional print
  • Develop, source and manage a library of digital content including images, photos, and videos
  • Develop content and variants for A/B testing, and apply learnings to future projects
  • Collaborate across the team (Marketing, Sales, Customer Success, Product, Design, Senior Leadership) and produce creative marketing materials
  • Draft & own our external marketing branding guidelines to ensure consistency across all external facing material
  • Partner with the Design manager to maintain a consistent visual brand, and contribute to its evolution
  • Manage design agency and agency projects
  • Collaborate with internal marketing team members to help develop campaign strategies and bring great ideas into reality
  • Create visuals that optimize each medium, following and staying up to date on best practices and accessibility standards, and B2B marketing trends and research
  • Empathize with our users - learning about our customer journey and profiles
Qualifications
  • Portfolio of work demonstrating exceptional and creative skills, including video editing and website design (portfolios to be submitted along with resume).
  • 5+ years of experience in a digital marketing design role at B2B SaaS, technology, or recurring revenue model companies
  • Exceptional design and creative skills, including video editing
  • Proficient in website design, with an understanding of conversion rate optimization best practices
  • Exceptional listening and communication skills, with the ability to effectively communicate creative ideas in a verbal and written manner
  • Ability to empathize with our users + translate complex products into compelling messaging
  • Experience collaborating across functions (Marketing, Product, Sales, CS)
  • Experience collaborating with and directing outside design agencies
  • Knowledge of latest B2B marketing and design best practices, technologies and developments, including those that that affect engagement and conversion rate
  • Working knowledge of (or eager willingness to rapidly learn): Unbounce, Squarespace, Lumen5,Google Analytics, Hotjar, SEO best practices
  • Expert level mastery of design programs such as Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign, Premiere Pro, After Effects, etc), video creation/editing software, Figma, Powerpoint, HTML, CSS, Google Suite
About you
  • Great eye for design, photography, and website layouts
  • Strong project manager who can oversee and prioritize various projects running simultaneously
  • Ability to build trust and inclusive relationships with various stakeholders including those with different backgrounds, life experiences and expertise
  • Committed to supporting a diverse, inclusive, and collaborative work environment
  • Self-starter with a high level of intellectual curiosity that executes independently and takes incredible pride in their work; willingness and ability to learn new concepts
  • Comfortable both giving and receiving design feedback
  • A data-driven mindset; strong desire to solve problems, optimize processes and manage data
  • Understanding of web accessibility standards and best practices
  • A passion for social media, content marketing, and supporting nonprofits
Compensation & Benefits

Why Resilia? Resilia powers the people changing the world.

Resilia is an inclusive and welcoming workplace where our team thrives on collaboration, creativity, innovation, and fun. We are proud to offer competitive salary commensurate with experience and excellent benefits including unlimited PTO, medical, dental, vision and life insurance, a 401k program, mental health support, a healthcare advocate, short-term disability, and commuter benefits, with potential for equity stake in a fast growing company.

Resilia is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of an individual's sex, age, race, color, creed, national origin, alienage, religion, marital status, pregnancy, sexual orientation or affectional preference, gender identity and expression, disability, genetic trait or predisposition, carrier status, citizenship, veteran or military status and other personal characteristics protected by law. All applications will receive consideration for employment without regard to legally protected characteristics.

results.title: Service Design Director
results.description:
We’re looking for a Service Design Director to join our team at Futurice UK. As a Director in the Service Design discipline, you’ll coach our cross-functional product teams to create impactful and accessible digital service solutions. You’ll mentor some of the brightest minds in human-centred design, user research, and product development. You’ll collaborate with leaders in Product Design and Technology to define best practices for multi-disciplinary teams and clients to work together. Finally, you’ll have the opportunity to make a real impact, guiding our clients from early discovery to service delivery.

 

What you are responsible for

  • Overseeing multiple project teams, inspiring them with provocative ideas and methods, unblocking challenges, and ensuring their success

  • Upholding discipline excellence for service design, qualitative and quantitative research with continuously updated processes and tools

  • Identifying opportunities for professional learning and development for the service design team

  • Consulting with clients at both product management and top executive levels, from co-writing briefs to ensuring satisfactory delivery

  • Coaching our client organisations’ to build their internal capabilities, specifically on the topics of human-centred research and design.

  • Growing existing client accounts by identifying opportunities, underpinned by mutual trust built on excellent client service

  • Supporting our connection with the wider Service Design community and professional groups, building our network and identifying amazing talent at conferences, speaking engagements, publications, etc.

  • Contributing to the sparkling culture of the Futurice team in your own unique way, and by doing so, inspiring others to do the same.

  

Some of the things we expect to see:

  • 10+ years’ experience working in service design or similar role.

  • Experience coaching cross-functional teams in a fast-paced environment.

  • Expert level knowledge of the latest approaches in planning, conducting, and synthesising user research.

  • Expert level knowledge of the latest approaches in planning, conducting, and synthesising client workshops and co-creation sessions in multi-stakeholder environments.

  • A critical eye for effective, detailed, and scalable user journeys and service blueprints.

  • Consulting or agency experience, working collaboratively with client teams

 

As a bonus, you might have:

  • Degree in design, anthropology, or related field.

  • Experience in strategic foresight, futures or trend analysis.

  • Experience creating strategies for proposition/product ecosystems and roadmaps.

  • Experience in change management, operational improvement or metrics consulting.

  • Experience in the physical world running service safaris or pilot service trials.

  • A portfolio which includes case studies in: mobility, energy or sustainability

  • Clear visual communication skills

 

What we care about

 

Our Culture – We are human first. Mutual respect and trust is essential, as is curiosity, talent and energy. All team members need to be self-starters and have a desire to be part of a low hierarchy work culture built on a foundation of Nordic straightforwardness.

 

How we work – We’re a talented team of designers, strategists, and software engineers working hard to create a progressive environment, culture, and set of capabilities. In the UK we operate a remote-first setup, centred on London, with regular days spent working together IRL as a full team. We take pride in our craft and a commitment to a people-first, one-team mentality.

 

Flexibility – Not a morning person? Need to pick the kids up from school? We believe in well-rested people doing concentrated, impactful work and offer flexible working hours and locations.

 

What we can offer you

  • Competitive salary

  • Company pension contribution of 6%

  • Company bonus scheme

  • Private health insurance 

  • 25 days of holidays + 1 extra for your birthday

  • A tiered parental leave policy, which offers 16 weeks maternity full pay and 3 weeks partner full pay (dependent on your tenure)

  • Time and budget for personal development

  • Company credit card 

  • Team get-togethers and a weekly lunch and share

  • Team trips and group activities 

  • A monthly personal wellness budget 

  • Cycle to work scheme

 

Don’t worry about whether you’re a 100% fit! Take a look at what we do and what we've done and get in touch. Don’t just tell us where you’ve worked or studied, tell us who you are, where you are heading, and why you want to join us! 

 

More about our process 

We’d love to see a portfolio you’re proud of. We’d expect you to show us examples of successfully launched products, services and results that demonstrate strategic, conceptual and creative thinking. And to tell us how they reflect your comprehensive understanding of the design process.

 

We usually follow the following format for interviews, currently all held remotely:

 

  • 30min video/telephone introductory call

  • 1hr interview with 2 people, a developer and a designer

  • 1hr interview with 2 directors

     

Salary: £80,000 - £110,000

 

Inclusion and diversity are critical to the success of Futurice, and we actively encourage applications from people of all backgrounds. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity without regard to race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, disability or any other protected category. We will offer interviews at times that suit your schedule and circumstances. Please get in touch if you have any questions or if there is anything we can do to make the process more accessible and convenient for you.

results.title: Product Designer
results.description:
About us

Electric vehicle sales are surging - over half of new cars sold as of 2030 globally are predicted to be electric. But one of the most challenging elements of owning an electric vehicle is its charging and that’s where we come in.

We set up in 2018 to make EV charging simple, green and low cost for drivers, to encourage EV adoption and reduce carbon emissions from transport. Core to our platform is a proprietary smart-charging algorithm, dynamically aligning charging with intermittent low-carbon electricity, reducing carbon emissions from grid electricity by as much as 70%. We've so far secured over 13 million USD in funding, have over 100k drivers using our app, and were named 'Best Energy Startup in the World' when we won the Free Electrons programme.

To achieve all of this, we gathered a great team bringing expertise from their previous roles at National Grid, Bulb, BBOX, Powervault, BCG, Starling, and more. We're now over 70 people working fully remotely across Europe and North America, and pride ourselves on our inclusive and collaborative culture.

We're aiming to have over a million drivers using our product, and we're looking for even more talented and passionate folk to join our mission.

The role

Our Driver team is looking for a hands-on, self-motivated Product Designer to work on our solar product.

 

We’ve developed our solar feature to the point of MVP stage - we’re now ready to progress to full development and feature expansion. Launching this product will forge new partnerships that will help us reach hundreds of thousands of customers. This is an exciting time to join a small but rapidly growing team where you will have the opportunity to be involved in all aspects of the product development process.

 

As our Product Designer, you will be responsible for designing and prototyping new user experiences based on product requirements. Deliverables include design mockups, prototyping, production of visual assets and importantly, the documentation required for proper implementation.

 

As a key part of our design team you’ll flourish in a dynamic start-up environment and adapt to changing priorities and deadlines. You’ll be a natural collaborator and an excellent communicator.

 

You have a keen eye for details and aesthetics, but your strengths lie in distilling complex issues and data, breaking them down into iterations and translating them into clean, simple solutions. You must be a self-starter, able to work independently and perform multiple tasks under minimal supervision.

What will you do? 

Design and ship new features end-to-end and drive product improvements
Tackle ambiguous design problems
Work cross-functionally with product managers, engineers and your design peers
Create, collaborate and iterate on design work, from concept to high-fidelity
Translate data-heavy screens into user-friendly interactions
Build a product that our users love 

 

What are we looking for?

A strong command of visual and communication design principles
Fluid written and spoken English, to collaborate with peers across the company
Confidence and skill with Figma, our main design tool
Ability to design app experiences from start to finish
Familiarity with the product development process
Clear and careful annotation skills 

 

We’d love to hear from you if you:

Are highly logical, detail-oriented and actively demonstrate that you care about great usability
Are able to function independently and in a team, with excellent collaboration skills
Consider research and validation a key part of product design
Have worked with highly technical products in previous roles
Have an interest in sustainability, green tech or electric vehicle
Have worked with cross-functional teams of engineers and product managers in the past 

You don’t need to:

Be a master at every design discipline and tool ever invented
Have a website - PDF’s or notion pages with case studies including process breakdowns and impact of your work will be fine
Have a professional qualification
Know how to code (but knowing how developers work is key) 

Have a specific number of years of experience - but you should be able to demonstrate real-world experience with cross-functional teams building complex products 

 

If you’re excited about our company and the role but you feel you don’t match the points above perfectly, we still hope you’ll apply as soon as possible so we can consider your application!

 

Your application will not be considered without a portfolio/case study and CV.

How will we support you?
  • Remote working, investing in your home office setup or a co-working location convenient for you
  • Access to conferences, meet-ups and training
  • A top of the range Macbook Pro and all you need to do your best work
  • A structured career progression framework and advancement opportunities
  • Fully-loaded benefits including health, dental, vision, life and 401(k)
  • Paid parental leave
  • Generous equity in the company, with options to earn more shares as you progress
  • Quarterly team meet-ups, to collaborate and have fun in person!

If you don’t have all of the requirements but you’re really interested in what we’re doing, please apply anyway! We’d love to hear from you and may be able to tailor the role around your abilities and experience. We value applicants regardless of their background or years of experience.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. 

We have a transparent salary and progression framework. The salary range is £53,000 - £69,000 depending on how we assess you against our framework during interviews.

results.title: Graphic Designer
results.description:
Hello, prospective creative! 

Ready to begin your journey to the best creative role ever?
Make Relish, in partnership with Design Pickle, is changing lives through our creative products and services. Keep reading to get more information and check out the requirements below! All open roles are Independent Contractor roles within our organization.

Keep in mind that candidates are required to be available during the US Time zone!

 

Who We Are Looking For:

First, Make Relish is anything but typical. We're a group of hard-working, creativity-loving individuals from around the world. You will work directly with Design Pickle customers to make the best creative work they've seen in their lives!

Do we love pickles, too? Most of us! But don't stress if pickles aren't your thing. It's not a deal-breaker. We do look for passion and interest in something though because our uniqueness is what helped make us into the great company we are today.

We stand by our vision, purpose, and values, and these are mission-critical to how you show up every single day.

Requirements
  • Advanced knowledge in Adobe CC programs required
  • Friendly and positive attitude
  • Great team player attitude
  • Proficiency communicating in English
  • Experience handling customers
  • Own reliable computer that meets these Requirements
  • Internet connection above 20 Mbps
Specific to your role, we're looking for individuals who:
  • Have graphic design experience.
  • Possess strong attention to detail.
  • Can demonstrate proficiency in Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator, and InDesign.
  • Have experience creating presentations in PowerPoint, and Google Slides.
  • Have experience utilizing Canva.
  • Enjoy looking up and learning new things quickly.
  • Have an eye for accuracy, detail, and quality control.
  • Have excellent communication and client handling skills (Customer Support experience is a plus!).
  • Can actively communicate with customers in written English in real-time.
  • Communicate effectively with their assigned Team Coordinator.
  • Own a reliable computer with Adobe CC AI, PSD, and INDD installed.
  • Stay up-to-date with new design techniques and software.
  • Efficiently and pragmatically execute graphic design requests within our scope of service.
Compensation and Perks:
  • 100% remote work
  • Above-average industry pay rates
  • Fast-tracked development potential
  • Subsidized Adobe CC subscription
  • Consistent payout schedule
  • Diverse creative community
  • Amazing culture guided by our Core Values
  • Performance-based incentives
  • And so much more!

You can learn more about our company, our vision, and what we stand for here!  We can't wait to meet you—thank you in advance for your application!

Important information:

  • This is an Independent Contractor role with Make Relish LLC, a Design Pickle Partner. You can read more information here.
  • Keep in mind that the current role is only available in Indonesia. Availability during regular US PST/EST & Jakarta business hours is required. Applications from other countries will be rejected.

results.title: Architectural Visualizer / 3D Designer
results.description:
We are seeking an experienced Architectural Visualizer / 3D Designer to join our Design team. This role will report directly to the Chief Design Officer.

The Ideal Architectural Visualizer /3D Designer will have a passion for visual design, attention to detail, and the ability to fine-tune our building designs through continuous iterations. You will bring our architectural designs and buildings to life, creating high-quality photo-realistic 3D images and animations of buildings and future developments.

Norhart is driven by a simple purpose, to create a better way for us all to live. To fulfill that purpose, we need a fantastic team. We are fighting to be the best in the world at what we do. The only way we can do that is by employing the very best talent.

Why Work at Norhart?

  1. Great Culture! We received the 2022 Star Tribune's "Minnesota Top Workplaces Award"! Working alongside great people at a great company makes your job and your life better.
  2. Growth opportunity! We are growing like crazy and company growth creates career opportunities for our employees.
  3. We pay at the top of the market! We consistently monitor pay ranges in the industry and we choose to pay at the top of the market.
  4. Great Benefits! We have fantastic benefits such as Medical, Dental, Vision, Retirement contributions, and so much more! Our benefits start on the first of a new month of employment.
  5. Unlimited paid-time-off!!! This is something unique in our industry. We want our employees to bring their full selves to work and give it their all. This means sometimes you need to recharge and our unlimited PTO plan helps our employees do just that.

NORHART’S MISSION, PURPOSE & VALUES:

Mission: Building and managing awesome apartments

Purpose: Creating a better way for us all to live

Values: A great team is made up of great people. In our company these people exhibit 5 key values. These values are a way of life for everyone who works here. From our top-level managers to entry level employees these values are lived out every day. We hire and promote based on these characteristics. To be successful here you too must embody these values.

  • Achieve Great Things: We love our work! We were born to do it. We accomplish far more than what others thought possible. We exhibit unrelenting reliability. When we say something will be done, it will be done. We solve the root problem instead of settling for a quick fix.
  • Improving Something Every Day: We dare to question the status quo. We are always looking for ways to simplify, automate, and change the ‘normal workflow’. One way that we do this is to dedicate ourselves to make small changes and improvements every day, with the expectation that those small improvements will add up to something significant.
  • Be a Genuine Human: Being a genuine human means that we are kind, supportive, and humble. We share credit, admit our mistakes, and learn from them. We are open, honest, and vulnerable. It’s about being fully and painfully honest about work related issues in a respectful and positive way while building professional friendships.
  • Obsessing Over the Resident Experience: Obsessing over the resident experience means we strive to ensure a frictionless environment for our tenants such as caring about every little impact our work has on them. It is relentlessly improving our building designs, taking on feedback, and considering their overall well-being in every action we take. From the moment we break ground on a new project, to the final day we serve a resident, it is the responsibility of EVERY Norhart employee to OBSESS over the experience that resident is going to have with us.
  • Level Yourself Up: We want to be the best in the world at what we do. We want to be so much better than the competition that the fight isn’t fair. We own our own self-improvement, and we push our mentors to teach us more. We are always looking for ways to improve our company, our team, and ourselves.

 

What You Will Work On

  • Work closely with the Chief Design Officer and the Director of Architecture to plan and visualize construction projects.
  • Ensure all designs are represented as accurately and attractively as possible .
  • Create both high-quality photo-realistic 3D static images/ visualizations and animations.
  • Ability to work self-sufficiently as well as collaboratively in a small high-performance team.
  • Comfortable working under deadlines and managing multiple projects at once.
  • Must be an excellent communicator, both verbal and written.
  • Keep up-to-date with relevant software advances.

 

Requirements

We're looking for someone with 8+ years of experience in Architectural Visualization and 3D Design who has demonstrated these skills:

  • Autodesk Revit experience.
  • Bluebeam experience.
  • Proficient in 3ds Max, Corona 9 Renderer, Lumion, Twin Motion Photoshop, SketchUp, and Rhino.
  • AutoCAD, Unreal Engine, ZBrush experience is a plus.

Benefits

  • Fantastic Health Care Plan offering a $0 monthly premium for coverage
  • Dental Coverage
  • Vision Coverage
  • Retirement Plan with company match up to 3% (Simple IRA)
  • Unlimited Paid Time Off (Vacation & Holidays)
  • Volunteer Time Off (16 hours per year of paid time off to volunteer at your favorite charity)
  • Life Insurance (Basic, Voluntary & AD&D)
  • Short Term & Long Term Disability
  • Maternity & Paternity Leave
  • Training & Development
  • Career Advancement Opportunities

results.title: Senior Designer
results.description:
At Lively, we pride ourselves on making games full of character. The world is fun and silly and sad and infuriating and banal and beautiful and ugly and all of those things have a place in our games. Lively is a sister studio to Electric Square, and across our 4 studios, many projects, 230 people (and studio dogs (and cats)) we offer you a comfortable and comforting studio culture that we hope can make you feel empowered and inspired.

The whole Electric Square family hungers for difference — we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products, and our community. We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace providing a comprehensive benefits package and an award-winning environment to work in, rating 4.4 out of 5 stars for employee satisfaction on glassdoor.com! And we are not idle - we always strive to do better by our employees.

We are currently looking for a lovely Senior Designer to join our Lively team. We’re based in Leamington Spa but we are fully supportive of remote working and happy to enable whatever blend of home and office best empowers you and your work.

What Does a Senior Designer Do at Lively?

We are looking for someone with the experience, wisdom and hands-on skills to help guide design of our games here at Lively. We highly value people skills and people who are great to work with, those who like to take responsibility and push for wonderful solutions, and those with a mind for elegance and simplicity.

We want to give you the chance to shine and ensure our games come alive in the hearts and minds of our players, while working closely with other disciplines to make sure creative dreams can become practical reality.

We are firm believers that people should be the most them they can be, and we want to find someone we can genuinely give opportunities to grow and excel.

  • Uses the right mix of skills, knowledge and wisdom to help the team pragmatically deliver elegant and joyful experiences for players.
  • Balances hands on work with feedback and coaching to ensure the team excels as a unit.
  • Communicates smoothly and clearly within the design team, with other disciplines and with clients and external developers.
  • Responds to and implements feedback from data analysis, reviews and playtests.
  • Works with other designers and whole team to ensure the game is delivering the correct experience for the audience and commercial intentions of the game.
  • In the most wholesome way imaginable, loves what they do, and we can tell. (This isn’t a codeword for crunch. The day is over. Go home. So to speak...)

Requirements

Things we'd love to see from you:

  • Experience in the racing genre. This is an important role, and we need to be confident that we are in safe hands.
  • Enthusiasm for or experience in UX.
  • Experience of working in Unreal.
  • Be passionate, curious, motivated and open to giving and receiving constructive feedback.
  • Have a fascinatingly broad palette of references and inspirations to draw from and educate us with.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Be able to work well as a team player in a collaborative environment.
  • Have a love of creating unforgettable, utterly loveable gaming experiences for the audience

If you’re wondering if you should apply or not, we hope that you do.

Benefits

When you join Electric Square, you can expect to enjoy a unique culture. Whether it’s participating and relaxing with one of our wellness benefits or discussing the latest games over lunch cooked at one of Leamington Spa’s incredible eateries. The Studio knows that it’s the best people that make the best games and this is what Electric Square invests in. Below you will find all the benefits and perks you can enjoy as an Electric Square team member.

 

  • Holidays - 25 days’ annual leave entitlement including studio closure over the Christmas period plus all UK bank holidays
  • Bonus Anniversary Holidays - An additional day of annual leave for each year’s anniversary working at Electric Square, up to a maximum of 30 days of annual leave entitlement.
  • Generous Team Project Bonuses
  • Company Pension Scheme – Employer contribution matching award winning pension scheme provided by NEST under the UK governments automatic enrolment scheme.
  • Private Medical Insurance Scheme – Full private medical cover provided by AXA PPP Private Healthcare.
  • Group Income Protection
  • Health and Well-being Allowance – £50 per month to spend on your choice of a range of healthy activities, ranging from going to the gym, rock climbing, yoga and a lovely massage. It's on us!
  • Group Life Insurance
  • Private Dental Insurance Scheme – Full private dental cover provided under our Dental plan company scheme.
  • Cycle to Work Scheme – Salary sacrifice cycle purchase scheme with tax savings through Evans Cycles.
  • Tech Scheme - Over 5000 products available from to buy over 12 or 24 month payment terms, saving up to 12% on National Insurance.
  • Electra's Beer & Wine Fridge – Free beers, ales and wine and even the odd gin and tonic! Grab a beer at our end of week Show and Tell sessions and see what everybody else in the company has been up to!
  • Free soft drinks to keep you refreshed throughout the day. Remember your sugar intake, though, folks!
  • Free Electric Square Monthly Friday Team Lunch – Monthly Friday lunches have become a way of life here at ES. It’s a wonderful way to sit and enjoy a bit of food and drink together as a team outside of the day to day at the studio.
  • Eye-care Vouchers – Free eye tests.
  • Train Travel Season Ticket Loan – Interest free company loan to spread the cost of an annual season ticket.
  • Personal Trainer Sessions – Free gym sessions with our own Electric Square personal trainer.
  • Fast Growing Studio – We're only getting bigger, so there's plenty of room for career advancement.
  • Industry Conferences Budget – Many of our employees benefit every year from attending conferences such as GDC in San Francisco, Siggraph, E3, Unite, Unreal Fest Europe and more.
  • Free locally roasted Coffee & Speciality Teas
  • Free Cereal Bar – Extensive granola, muesli and breakfast cereal selections.
  • Extensive Video Game & Book Library – Borrow a game, a book or even a whole console!
  • Free Awesome Swag – Amazingly designed Electric Square T-shirts and merch, with the now iconic Electra emblazoned on the front. New ranges out every season.
  • Dogs with Jobs – Electric Square is a dog friendly employer. Bring doggo into the studio to meet and hang out with the rest of the team any time!
  • Exhibitions & Days Out – If there is an event happening of interest to us, we’ll happily spread the word, pick up the bill and see if any Electrons are up for going – we’re keen to get you everyone out seeing what’s going on.
  • Project Wrap Parties, Cinema Nights & Team Social Events – We work hard together so it’s good to let off steam and spend some time together.
